Reviews.Title: “My home in Key West”
Reviews.Author: Steven O
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Marquesa felt like being at home in Key West. This was my first stay, but I know I will be back. Starting with Henry, who was very pleasant and professional when initially taking my phone reservations and then greeting us upon our arrival, made my wife and I feel like family. Bob was very accommodative with some special requests and went far beyond my expectations in helping me. Richard offered the same professional and friendly attention when I needed immediate assistance, and Carol helped make the check out process a quick and painless process. The restaurant staff at the Marquesa is also top notch. Manager Dave Bell made sure the impeccable service matched the quality of the food. And Bonnie was the best server we ever had. I highly recommend the Marquesa to all savvy travelers who want to make their visit to Key West a very special event.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Beautifully Styled, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Dovermom60
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Marquesa and loved the location: central to everything, but far enough from the noise and less than congenial aesthetics of Duvall Street. We were able to walk to an abundance of fabulous restaurants, but found the best of all was the Cafe Marquesa in the hotel. The concierge service was great: they booked terrific scuba trips for our 17-yr-old son, bikes, and schooner trips for my husband and me, plus the trip to the Dry Tortugas. Beautifully appointed rooms and grounds, with attentive service. A true oasis in midst of old town. Look forward to our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Marquesa”
Reviews.Author: wintersummer
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Marquesa. You can tell from all the previous reviewers that it is a great place to stay, with the best service and beautiful grounds and rooms. There's one aspect of the stay that prevents the Marquesa from being perfect. If you are researching the hotel, you know that it is not inexpensive. When paying a certain price, it is always nice to feel like you are getting something a bit "extra", however small it might be. In the case of the Marquesa, I think providing a complimentary breakfast, if only something light, would be such a nice addition to their guest services. You can obtain a continental breakfast for $10, but it seems like a way to charge guests for something extra. Also, it would have been delightful to have some sort of snack offered with the afternoon iced tea. Good food often helps establish strong memories of hotel stays for us, if only a few freshly baked muffins and coffee.

Reviews.Title: “The Marquesa is our favorite destination”
Reviews.Author: xp76er
Reviews.Content: This is our third stay at the Marquesa and the third time we loved it! Friendly staff from reservations--they worked hard to accommodate our date change and room preference--to keeping the grounds beautiful to reserving bikes and tours for us. The location is ideal. We enjoy being close to the grocery store and can walk to the movie theater and restaurants. But really, our favorite activity is sitting by the gorgeous patio and pools, drinking iced tea, and talking to fellow guests.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot for rest and relaxation”
Reviews.Author: WaupacaTraveller
Reviews.Content: This small guesthouse continues to deliver a top notch vacation experience. It's well located near the noise and bussle of Duval Street, but it is a quiet place with beautiful grounds and 2 pools. Rooms are well appointed. The junior suites have plenty of room for rest, reading and dining on a generous patio. Staff is helpful and friendly. Hotel is 1 block from a grocery store making meals on your terrace easy and fun. This was my first time visiting during the on season. Weather was great and no humidity. The only thing I noticed is that during the on season the guests tended to be more in the 60+ age group and there were less folks under 50. This maybe is reflective of rates and school vacation schedules.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: KristiGolden
Reviews.Content: The Marquesa was conveniently located in town,the service was impeccable,and our room was beautiful and clean. I can't say enough wonderful things about this place. We will definitely be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Marquesa Hotel Key West”
Reviews.Author: PeterLongIsland
Reviews.Content: Beautiful place. Friendly service . Great location . Walk to Duval Street

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, formal small hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chickens_everywhere
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two nights and couldn't get a third night so moved on to another hotel. This place is run beautifully. The breakfast in the courtyard is great, everything is immaculate and stylish, even the orchids are all blooming. The guests seemed a little uptight but management can't control that. For instance, one night three of us gathered on our porch at 6 pm to share wine before dinner and the woman in the adjacent room came out and said, "Could you please keep it down- we're trying to take a before dinner nap!" Not as if we were running our own karaoke machine, geez!

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite, without pretension”
Reviews.Author: Worldtraveler68
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from an absolutely wonderful stay at the Marquesa, where I am torn between determining whether the service, or the actual room was best. From the moment I called to place my reservation, I received first-rate, warm, and precise service. Really, flawless. This level of service is so unexpected that it really is such a pleasant "shock" to experience. The purpose of my trip to Key West (my first visit) was to explore the area, escape the mid-winter chill in the Midwest, and to have a fun time with a good friend. We booked two rooms adjacent to one another, and really used the Marquesa as our base of operations for heading out to nearby Duval Street and other popular Key West venues. We also enjoyed simply sitting on our veranda, listening to the soothing sounds of the courtyard, and quiet. My room was spotless - very clean, fresh linen and a comfortable bed, where i enjoyed a quiet night's rest. Bottom line: I travel all over the world, and have stayed in many legendary places. Marquesa is among the very best.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, very accommodating staff”
Reviews.Author: tussey22
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marquesa Hotel in Key West for our 20th Anniversary. The hotel is very nice, clean, and comfortable. Our first room was on the main street side and was a little too loud for us but the staff (Bob) rearranged some things to allow us to move into a different room that was much quieter. They have two pools, one heated and one not. They will also serve breakfast by the pool which was nice. And it is a great location to Duvall Street. Close enough that everything is in walking distance but far enough away from the night time craziness. WOuld definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “A True KEY Jewel!”
Reviews.Author: DrThought
Reviews.Content: When I was told about the Marquesa by my American Express agent, she said it was a lovely and well managed guest house, just off Duval Street, one of the main drags in Key West. We reserved one of the suites at the Marquesa for a night - before going on to Little Palm Island for my wife's 50th getaway. While on the plane I casually checked the reviews on the Marquesa... (yeah, I know... a wee bit late, yes, but when I was scheduling the trip, my wife's father was passing and everything was too nutso, so I simply 'went' with the Amex advice.) So imagine my discomfort when I read a review giving the MARQUESA 3 out of 5 stars... not a good moment. Ahhhh, but when we were taken by cab from the Key West Airport to the 600 Flemming Street address of The Marquesa, my concerns lessened. The staff greeted us with warmth and courtesy, and 'Richard' sat down to complete our arrival papers. Ok, this Richard guy... this is NOT his 1st Rodeo! What a terrific and accomodating gentleman this was. He took my request for dinner reservations, promptly had us reserved at a marvelous seafood bistro, and then accompanied us to the suite. One look at my wife upon entering the suite erased any concerns about that ridiculous 3 star review. Either this was a very old set of reviews, or the 4 people who wrote the reviews lacked any and all cerebral capacity. The room was bright, dang near 'antiseptic' clean, and wonderfully appointed with very comfortable classic furniture in refreshing green and white patterns... yeah, beautifully 'Key West'd'! As soon as he had welcomed us to our suite Richard asked us if we'd enjoy a glass of wine... and he soon returned with a glass of Sauvignon Blanc for my wife and a delightful Pinot Noir for me. Yeah... 3 star â€¦ uh uh! No way! The Marquesa is wonderfully situated about 1 1/2 blocks from Duval Street, and even better, from Starbucks! It's only a five minute walk down to Mallory Square, through all the kitschy and classy shops, and to the water docks where restaurants abound. The sleep at the Marquesa was blessed, and the mattress and pillows were 5 Star comfort. My wife and I have been fortunate to be able to experience some truly marvelous places, The Point in Saranac Lake, Little Palm Island, Cayo Espanto in Belize, and other amazing spots to rest your soul. While the Marquesa is not what I would call a â€˜resortâ€™... it IS one beautiful, comfortable, VERY clean, and well cared for little gem in Key West! This is a place we will surely come back to!!

Reviews.Title: “Always Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: C R C
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at The Marquesa for the last three years. The hotel is a beautiful, peaceful place to stay in Key West. The location is perfect for walking and biking. The Cafe Marquesa is a very nice spot for cocktails and dinner. It is an oasis with breath-taking waterfalls and landscaping with two pools. The entire staff's friendliness and helpfulness will make your stay very pleasant. We love a lot of things about Key West, but a stay here makes it even better.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect getaway for two”
Reviews.Author: Sbroumand_Nomad
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here three times over the years and it never fails to satisfy. Everything is perfect. Rooms are magnificent, food in the cafe is first rate, and the pool is the best spot in town. Romantic beyond description.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Yet”
Reviews.Author: fre3h
Reviews.Content: We visit Key West often but have been staying at different places. We have now settled in to our favorite! Close to Duval but peaceful and secluded when you want it. The service was great, clean rooms,beautiful gardens and pool, helpful staff, and great bed. Walk every place in old town made easy. Take my word and enjoy the Conch Republic in style.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven”
Reviews.Author: Jenny S
Reviews.Content: We just returned from an incredible stay at the marquesa. We stayed in room 18, a beautiful suite with a patio overlooking the pool. We just love the feel of this hotel, you really feel like you are staying at a friend's house. The staff was very attentive but inconspicuous. I swear the housekeeping staff watched us leave because if we were gone, we came back to a full ice bucket and a tidy room. Can't wait to return next year!

Reviews.Title: “The Marquesa”
Reviews.Author: Allende77
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at The Marquesa Hotel from 5-8 January 2012. Our room and the hotel were supurb. The facility was well maintained and nicely decorated. The pool areas and flowers were beautiful. The gentlemen manning the desk were helpful and knowledgeable with suggestions for restaurants, and for places to visit. One suggestion: Offer a daily, early evening wine and cheese â€˜happy hourâ€™. The one evening wine and cheese happy hour was very enjoyable and provided and opportunity to meet and enjoy other guests.

Reviews.Title: “recent visit”
Reviews.Author: Stephen K
Reviews.Content: We have been to the Marquesa at least 4 times over maybe a 6/7 year period or so. It is always a great spot but most important-it has maintained it's feel. There has been no drop off in appearance or staff support. I find it rare that a hotel that invested so much capital and tender loving care at the beginning can carry that feeling thru the years without a drop off in ongoing investment or staff attitudes.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent reviews with a cause”
Reviews.Author: phdhonda
Reviews.Content: There's a reason for the high position of this hotel: it's really great from the check in to the check out and all the moments in between. We've stayed at room 23 with a balcony, green marble at bathroom, free wireless internet, flat TV and two queen beds. I can't imagine a more romantic place at Key West to stay whatever for. I just used my car to drive to the beaches area (Higgs and Rest Beach) and get to the Southernmost point in US at South st. Only con: no included breakfast. Last tip: Don't miss the sundown at Mallory Square at walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Pure Bliss”
Reviews.Author: MNSpark
Reviews.Content: Returned from our second stay at the Marquesa and once again, it was wonderful. This time we had a junior suite and it was one of the nicest rooms I have ever had at a hotel: a lovely porch, a sitting area and a great bed. The service was impeccable. We order the continental breakfast each morning - delivered in a timely fashion and very enjoyable. It is close to all of the major sites in Key West yet it is away from the crowd. I cannot say enough about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Romantic”
Reviews.Author: Jill D
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just stayed at the Marquesa Hotel. We have stayed at other hotels in KW, but by far this is our favorite. From our check in to our departure, we had the most accomidating service. We loved the small, immaculate setting, from the pool and grounds to the rooms. We both love everything about the Marquesa has to offer, so close to everything on Duval Street, but far enough away that you feel like you are removed from the world. It's amazing. We will definetly be booking our trip next year at the Marquesa Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel and restaurant were perfect”
Reviews.Author: kevin z
Reviews.Content: We have traveled the world and the Marquesa was one of the most unique and pleasant experiences we have ever had. Small, cozy, immaculate, quiet, high-touch service are all adjectives to describe our experience. We loved the restaurant for an anniversay night, so I was surprised by prior comment. Didn't have a car and never needed one.

Reviews.Title: “Close, but not too close”
Reviews.Author: Toronto1010
Reviews.Content: The Marquesa Hotel is ideally located to be close to all the action on Duval, but not so close that the noise disturbs the tranquility of the inner garden. The rooms are spacious and exceptionally clean. Some of the patios/balconies are more private than others, but it is a lovely feature. Room service is reasonably priced. The staff go out of their way to make sure your holiday is everything you would like it to be. Henry was absolutely fantastic to deal with. Avoid the restaurant at all costs. Truly terrible food, incompetent service, and high prices. Truly one of the worst dining experiences we have ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Julie B
Reviews.Content: The Marquesa Hotel was recommeded to us by the people at Key West Weddings by Aaron. We couldn't have picked a more perfect place for our wedding/honeymoon. The staff was extremely helpful when we booked the room, by helping us find a service to steam and press our wedding clothes as well as recommeding an excellent hair salon for my updo! Mary in the front office promptly returned my calls and made many suggestions for dining and shopping in the area. We were also pleasantly surprised upon check in to find that we had been upgraded to the honeymoon suite (we had booked one of the other equally beautiful rooms)! On the night of our wedding we ate dinner in the hotel's restaurant. They had a special table reserved and decorated for us (we were married on a nearby beach with no family/friends in attendance...our idea for a relaxing second wedding). The food was amazing and the waitstaff very attentive. We are planning on returning next year to celebrate our anniversary. :) See our pictures of the beautiful grounds...

Reviews.Title: “A jewel in Key West”
Reviews.Author: Bob G
Reviews.Content: We ran down to Key West for a five-day getaway. The Marquesa was perfect-excellent service, great location, elegance without being stuffy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Beth J
Reviews.Content: Perfect location not far from Duval. The grounds are beautiful with most of the rooms enjoying a porch and lovely view of the pools and lush foliage. Our room was elegant, clean and well appointed. The staff was very helpful. Parking is easy as the property has a garage for guest use. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service & Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: Ron T
Reviews.Content: From the minute we (group of 4 couples) entered The Marquesa Hotel through our departure the entire staff treated us with respect, politeness and as if we were guests in their own homes. They could not do enough to ensure that our visit was memorable. Also, being that check-out time was 12noon and our departure travel arrangements weren't until 5pm, the Management Team provided us with a room to store our luggage and use the facilities so that we could go out and continue our vacation until we were ready to depart. That is what you call going above and beyond. My wife and I generally visit Key West about once every 3 years and The Marquesa Hotel is definitely at the top of our list for future stays.

Reviews.Title: “Marquesa Hotel--Key West Florida--excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: Eric L
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Marquesa for 2 nights. Highly recommended. Excellent service. Jr Suite was well appointed and roomy. Continental breakfast on the private porch in front of the room--easy to take. Duval Street is only 2 blocks away, so you have access to all that but a beautiful, quiet, private place to stay. Pools are small but beautiful landscaping, comfortable chairs, quiet. Dinner in the attached restaurant was very good with a nice wine list. All in all, nothing but praise for this property and the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: mileskishnish
Reviews.Content: Nice setting, good location, very helpful and attentive staff. Will return.

Reviews.Title: “BEST STAFF EVER!!!”
Reviews.Author: Trevor M
Reviews.Content: My buddies and I went down to Key West for five days of drinking and shenanigans during the powerboat races. At the start of the trip there was like a 90% chance we were going to destroy the hotel room. As soon as we got there the staff was courteous, friendly, and extremely helpful even though most service people would have treated us poorly based on appearances. That changed our whole outlook and we were instead courteous, quiet, and clean. The staff is the best I have ever seen in a hotel. They had iced tea and coffee outside on a table by the beautiful pools. Every time we had a request for daytime activities, like jet skis and fishing, the concierge knew a guy who had a great deal for a good time. Plus, they were like janitorial ninjas, every time we went out we came back to a cleaned room and were never interrupted by housekeeping. How do they do that? It's close to Duval St with all of the associated bars and restaurants, and walking distance to anything of importance. (except the airport, meh) The only thing it could use was a microwave in the room, but the bigger suites probably have that.

Reviews.Title: “Marquesa Hotel - cleanest I've ever been in”
Reviews.Author: Tina W
Reviews.Content: We loved the location of the Marquesa. We did not have to drive our entire stay. Walked everywhere. CLEANIEST hotel I've ever been in. We stayed in a junior suite, which gave us our own porch. We thoroughly enjoyed that. Bathroom was nice big size too. The grounds are beautiful and never seemed crowded. Loved the homemade blueberry banana bread for breakfast. Very happy there was parking onsite. Bed was comfortable. Staff was outstanding. Can't think of anything to complain about....oh just noise a couple of mornings when trash truck made pick up woke us up, but we went back to sleep after.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay in Key West”
Reviews.Author: tsjha
Reviews.Content: The Marquesa is a very nice, small hotel convenient to downtown but far enough away to avoid the noise and crowds. We stayed in room #1, which is a junior suite. Large, comfortable room with sitting area. Private and quiet. Landscaping on the property is very nice and pools, while small, are very nice as well. Great getaway, especially for a special occasion.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in Key West”
Reviews.Author: girardo
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, quiet, perfect location. We especially enjoyed the lovely center courtyard with tropical vegetation and two pools and the friendly, gracious staff are exceptional. We needed to leave by 5:30 AM on our last day for a departing flight and the person on night duty took note and had coffee ready for us even though coffee service normally begins at 6:30 AM. We look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I never had to leave”
Reviews.Author: colleen w
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 night stay over Fantasy Fest week. Excellent location. You would never know you were 2 blocks from Duval. Quiet and relaxing. Small grocery store with beer and wine within a block,liquor store a few more stores down. Starbucks within 2 blocks,however the hotel serves free coffee and tea every morning and iced tea in the afternoon. Plenty of places to eat within 2 blocks. Jack Flats sports bar, make a left on Duval, great burgers and wings,watched EAGLES beat dallas!!! This hotel has EXCELLENT customer service,fresh towels in the evening when they turn down your bed,Henry was very helpful and generous with his time. We stayed in room 12 overlooking the 1st pool, nice size bathroom. 2 pools,heated and not. Plenty of chairs by the pool. I won't go anywhere else after this experience. I felt spoiled and relaxed, what more could you ask for.

Reviews.Title: “Fantasy Fest 2011 - the quiet, close, and comfortable place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ACS34141
Reviews.Content: We were well taken care of by everyone here, pampered in fact. Restaurant was fantastic as expected.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Relda1
Reviews.Content: Amazing stay with no distractions such as cell phones or children. Location is awesome with ample on site parking. Would pay double for the kind staff and immaculate rooms and grounds.

Reviews.Title: “Melrose Place-Key West Style”
Reviews.Author: traveladdictjr
Reviews.Content: We loved the Marquesa! The room and bathroom were large and immaculately clean. Really enjoyed sitting on our porch with a glass of wine at night. Check in was quick and easy. Parking could be tricky, it's on a first come basis, we, luckily, got a spot in the hotels covered garage which is attached to the property. The hotel is extremely quiet. So quiet, in fact, that it felt like we were staying outside the historical center, so relaxing! We hardly saw any staff yet everything was done to perfection and we never wanted for anything. I would be remiss not to mention the one negative spot in our stay: The sheets were very cheap,,,, to the point of being scratchy. In this day and age, even Hampton Inns are using high end sheets..... Just a suggestion that would make the hotel that much closer to perfect. Still, would recommend this hotel without hesitation! Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Our Favorite Place to Stay in Key West!”
Reviews.Author: Cindy B
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Marquesa Hotel. We love the accomodations, privacy, quiet pool area and the staff is very nice and accomodating. We brought another couple this year and they enjoyed it as well. The location is perfect for walking the duval and harbor street areas. Talk about being pampered! I love having the bed turned down and chocolate at my bedside! Who wouldn't! Can't wait to return next year. wisconsintravelers

Reviews.Title: “Private paradise !”
Reviews.Author: themagros
Reviews.Content: Hotel is beautifully restored! Great location just off of Duval Street. Would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We Return Every Year!”
Reviews.Author: GeneralManager96
Reviews.Content: This must have been at least our 10th stay at the Marquesa and we'll return again next year. We go to Key West each fall for our final week of sunshine and warm weather before winter settles in in New England. The main reason we return year after year is the Marquesa Hotel. The Junior Suites are more than comfortable - we spend as much time on the porch as we do in the room. The pool area is quiet and very relaxing. The grounds are beautiful and very well kept. All of the staff is great and many have been there for a long time - we always recognize several of the housekeepers, the "orchid" lady, maintenance staff and everyone at the Front Desk. The entire staff makes you feel welcome. To top it off, the Cafe Marquesa located next to the hotel has to be the best restaurant in Key West. Wonderful food, wonderful staff (again many of them have been there for a long time). We have to force ourselves to have dinner anywhere else. Had a wonderful stay again this year, wouldn't change a thing.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary Getaway”
Reviews.Author: simpljoy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed our 3 night stay from 10/10/2011 celebrating our 48th anniversary. This is the third time we've been guests at the Marquesa Hotel. Our accommodations were excellent. No compalints from hubby or me! Everything was to our satisfaction. The staff made our stay a special one. We'll be back for another visit for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect romantic getaway”
Reviews.Author: Bhead1968
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, enchanting, discreet and a very accommodating staff.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay.”
Reviews.Author: StuGrunt
Reviews.Content: Stayed with friends, just one night. What a nice surprise. The previous reviews here on tripadvisor were right. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Noone does it better”
Reviews.Author: jim h
Reviews.Content: Stayed 10/6/2011 for two nites. What a great find! Gorgeous room and pool area. Great staff. My wife felt pampered for her birthday surprise.

Reviews.Title: “The best! in all details”
Reviews.Author: Alan_and_Anna
Reviews.Content: everything is superb here: all little details in the main building, the garden around the pool, the porch of our room, the service. We spent two nights (28-29/09) of our two weeks in Florida and we wished we could stay more before traveling to Islamorada and Miami. After the check-in, Shion (?) took us to our room. It was on a second floor without elevator (it's an historic colonial style building). The room was fantastic, cozy with lots of space and light but we thought that we would have struggled with our two big and heavy luggage so the guy proposed us to move to the junior suite on ground level with private porch and luxurious bathroom and pay for the difference in rate. The extra price was not too high and we took it. At the end we spent fantastic moments there and it was by far the best place to stay. We did not use the pool because we stayed more on the beach and around, however it seemed fantastic and relaxing (guests are asked not to use their cells to avoid disturbing the other guests ;-). Even the complimentary coffee and tea in the morning is superb; same for the afternoon cold lemonade. There is even a private parking that's very handy in Key West

Reviews.Title: “"A Wonderful Week"”
Reviews.Author: Anne D
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here the last week in September as a last minute get away. The staff and accommodations were perfect. The pools were lovely and the restaurant was wonderful. Located close to all the action and local businesses work in tandem with the hotel to make everything as convenient as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Relaxing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sara T
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travelled to Key West this past week for a wedding. We were looking for some place relaxing and quiet and we knew that in Key West that would be hard to find. We found the Marquesa reviews and thought that this sounded just like what we were looking for. The previous reviewers told us the truth! The hotel was beautiful, very clean, the staff was friendly, polite and helpful. But probably the best part of the whole stay was the atmosphere. When you come in from the hustle of Duval street to a serene garden and pools and the only sound was waterfalls and palms shifting in the wind. The rooms were lovely and we even had our own private front porch overlooking the corner of Fleming and Simonton streets. I highly recommend the hotel and this will be the only place we stay on future trips to the island.

Reviews.Title: “You won't regret it!!”
Reviews.Author: LoBnMom
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a quick two night stay at the The Marquesa and i can't say enough about this hotel. You are struck instantly at the level of service you are given from any employee of this hotel you run into. The rooms were extremely clean, housekeeping comes and cleans up it seems as soon as they see you leave. They always refilled the ice chest which sounds like a little thing but when you're staying on a property that you have to climb many stairs to do anything, you really appreciate issues like the ice chest always being full. They give you turn down service at night, complete with wonderful chocolate. We will be going back to the Marquesa, again and again. Key West is one of our favorite places to go and now we have a new place to stay and tell everyone about. They have two pools, one is heated, the other is not. The landscaping is beyond beautiful at the Marquesa - trust me if you are going to Key West you want to stay here. I have been visiting Key West for the past twenty years, this is the best sleep I have ever had in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional accommodations”
Reviews.Author: gardendreamer
Reviews.Content: The Marquesa is a gem. Our room was beautifully decorated and well-appointed. The grounds are lovely, too. The hotel's owner could not have been more helpful. All-in-all, a perfect spot.

Reviews.Title: “Many time visitor to the Marquesa Hotel”
Reviews.Author: randy w
Reviews.Content: Just a fabulous, beautiful facility. Lush landscaping, charming atmosphere and ownership that really cares. It is kept meticulously. I think it is most probably the highest quality hotel in all of the Florida Keys.

Reviews.Title: “The best place to say in Key West!!”
Reviews.Author: jbturph
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Marquesa. The first time we stayed in a second floor room over looking the first pool. This year we decided to stay in a King Suite (Room #5). What a great choice on our part. My wife and I traveled to Key West with another couple who have been known to have upscale taste. They loved this place. It was clean, quiet and relaxing. They make you feel right at home and are very accomodating with any request. Again it was VERY clean ad quiet. The hotel is 2 blocks off of Duval and centrally located on the island. It was very convienent to walk to Mallory Square or the marina. There is a store right down the street from the hotel that sells everything from wine to beers and nachos. The scenery inside the Marquesa is amazing and the two pools were very clean and well kept. One is heated and the other is not but when the temperature drops from 90 degress to 85 degress at night it is hard to tell which is which. Coffee in the morning and water in the afternoon were readily availab le outside of our rooms. It is the most relaxing place to spend your time. The only concern I have of the hotel is the business office. The computers in this area are very dated and very slow. I would hope that they update these soon. trying to print out boarding passes from the archaic software took an extremely long time. Seems like a very easy fix. Also, the water pressure is very low when taking a shower. They are definitely missing the boat on table side service if for nothing else then drinks and small snacks. We all said we would never leave to eat breakfast or lunch if these were choices of ours. They have a resturant on the premises, so how hard could it be to send around a waitress to ask if we needed a drink or a snack? Again, a wonderful place to stay. You will not be disappointed and we will only stay here for our future visits to Key West. I am actually hoping that you do not stay here as to keep the prices reasonable for our return visit.

Reviews.Title: “A Quiet Sanctuary Near Duval Street”
Reviews.Author: OutdoorsGuy34
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful boutique hotel near Duval and the center of Old Key West that is blissfully quiet and relaxing. There are two beautiful pools surrounded by elegant landscaping to enjoy. Our only difficulty was figuring out the procedure for requesting poolside drinks and breakfast. However, the entire staff was pleasant and helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel”
Reviews.Author: svharter
Reviews.Content: Great experience from start to finish. Wonderful historic buildings, great staff, outstanding pools and gardens. This is exactly what we were looking for when we booked our "Adult" vacation and left the children home. The Marquesa delivered on all accounts. We'll definitely stay at the Marquesa again on return trips to Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Wish we could have stayed longer”
Reviews.Author: 44AML
Reviews.Content: A wonderful find, just blocks from the "fun", we wish we could have stayed longer. The place was beautiful, the rooms were great, the attention to detail was amazing. From the time we arrived Shawn made sure we had everything we needed. When we came back from doing the "Key West Crawl" our room had been cleaned, fresh towels, ice, turn down with chocolate, trash removed-very impressed. The best part is that you are just a few blocks from the fun/noise and you return to a quiet, blissful place to lay your head.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable Hotel and Experience”
Reviews.Author: bclarke
Reviews.Content: After reading the stellar reviews of hotel Marquesa on Trip Advisor, my wife and I decided to book a room there for our trip over Labor Day weekend. We ended up having one of the best hotel experiences of our lives. Check In: We arrived at the hotel in the early afternoon and were promptly greeted the beautiful lobby. The main building of the hotel is on the National Historic Registry and it has been meticulously restored. Our host at check in spent about 10 minutes orienting us using a map of Key West and then gave us a tour of the property. He then took us to our room (we were upgraded to a suite on the third floor) where we settled in and a few minutes later he arrived back with two glasses of complementary wine and a full ice bucket. There are no elevators allowed in the building because of the Historic status so if stairs are a problem, make sure you book a room on the first floor as they do not mention this when you make your reservation. The Room: Our room was in the Main House of the property. The property is comprised of three or four buildings surrounding a beautiful pool and garden area. The room was immaculate and extremely clean. The bed and bedding were what you would expect in a 5 star hotel. Many rooms on the property have balconies or porches. Ours did not but we were happy to sit outside by the pool and drink the complementary coffee and iced tea that is available throughout the day. There was a full mini bar with prices that were very reasonable considering the caliber of the hotel ($2.50 for bottled/sparkling water, $6 for cocktails). They also offer a continental breakfast for $10/person that they will either deliver to your room or set up for you at a table by the pool. Food in Key West: CafÃ© Marquesa: The first night we ate at the CafÃ© Marquesa which is on the first floor of the hotel. I would book this reservation though the hotel as it appeared we were given a better table because we were staying at the hotel. The food , and service were all excellent. With cocktails and a bottle of wine, we ended up spending around $130. This is the highest rated Zagat restaurant in Key West so if you are staying at the hotel, you will not want to miss it. Island Joes Coffee: Excellent coffee shop one block away from the hotel. Coffee is fantastic and they also serve a variety of breakfast options at very reasonable prices. Sarabethâ€™s: We had breakfast here one day and it was very good. They are known for their marmalade and I now understand why. It is only a block away from the hotel. It is a little pricy for breakfast but the quality of the breads and omelet we had was very high. Azur: We ended up going here for lunch one day. It is about 5 blocks east of the hotel. They have lunch specials for only $6. My wife and I couldnâ€™t decide what to get so we ordered 4 lunchesï�Š The seafood risotto and the gnocchi were some of the best that I have ever had. They also have 2 for 1 mimosas for lunch which were delicious. Half Shell Raw Bar: The hotel recommended this place to us. We ended up going here every afternoon for their $0.50 happy hour oysters. I am not usually a fan of gulf oysters but these were small to medium sized and absolutely delectable. I believe that happy hour runs from 4PM to 7PM. A wide selection of draft beer is available for less than $2 during happy hour and I believe other drinks are half off as well. Donâ€™t miss this place. Latitudes: Definitely the highlight of our trip. You have to take a ferry from the Westin near Mallory over to Sunset Key. Latitudes is in the main building of the Westin Guest Cottages resort and it spill outside onto a sandy beach. We had dinner at a very private table set up on wood decking on the beach. Food and service were excellent and the setting was truly remarkable. Not a cheap option by any means but we thought it was definitely worth it. This is probably the most difficult reservation in Key West so make sure you book in advance if you want a table outside. Activities: The only real activity we did (other than eating, drinking, and laying by the pool) was visit the Butterfly conservatory. Only $10 and definitely worth it. Thousands of butterflies of all shapes and sizes flying around you, landing on you, etc. Wow!! Summary: We had an amazing time. Canâ€™t wait to go back in a few months.

Reviews.Title: “The fabulous and beautiful Marquesa”
Reviews.Author: P R
Reviews.Content: The Marquesa is always my first choice for Key West. It's exactly what you need- beauty and quiet by the pools and beautiful landscaping. Or a few minutes away from the shops and restaurants and activity of Duval Street. Everything you want is walking distance. Each time I've stayed there, everyone has been so helpful and accommodating. They are wonderful and extremely knowledgeable about restaurants and things to do in Key West. Rooms are always spotless and comfortable. I have stayed here several times and will continue to choose the Marquesa (unless it's a trip with kids).

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie P
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel. It's perfect. Key West charm with very good style. Perfect location. In a quiet, beautiful neighborhood, but only 2 blocks from Duval. Beautiful pool area. Excellent service and very nice staff. Have stayed in all types of rooms, and they are all good.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED the Marquesa Hotel... next time we go back to Key West the Marquesa is where we will stay!”
Reviews.Author: Bridget F
Reviews.Content: First of all as soon as we stepped in the door we were greeted with smiles and wonderful people that were there to make sure we had the best time in Key West! Our room was just perfect.. We had a poolside standard. Very quiet, clean and awesome! We spent alot of time in the pool! We loved the free iced tea and water, and I have to say that the coffe in the morning was some of the best I have had at a hotel!!! The location was also perfect. Close to everything, yet very private...... I miss it :(

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Place to Stay in Key West”
Reviews.Author: flefton
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from our first trip to Key West. I had no idea where to stay but did know that I wanted to be close to the excitement of Duval Street, but not disturbed by it when I returned to my hotel. The Marquesa was the perfect choice; and aside from a great location, this hotel has character, and a fantastic staff, all for reasonable prices. Sounds too good to be true, but that is exactly what we experienced at this hotel. The pool area is beautiful, the rooms are clean, comfortable and spacious. To top it all, every morning there was fresh, good coffee waiting in the pool area. I can't say enough about how impressed we were with this hotel; we highly recommend it, and will stay there again next when we go back.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we were looking for, from location to excellent service, couldn't have been any more perfect!”
Reviews.Author: REIV
Reviews.Content: I work in the hospitality business and the entire staff at the Marquesa achieved the highest level of customer service in the 2 days we stayed that we encourage our team to accomplish with each of our guest each and every day. Friendly, prompt, courteous, and extremely helpful- completely defines excellent customer service. I highly recommend and will return very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in Key West”
Reviews.Author: Sverre S
Reviews.Content: This is actually one of the best hotels i have stayed at. Perfect location near the main street of Key West. A lovely hotel with a very good restaurant. If i ever come back to Key West i will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it here!”
Reviews.Author: GatorNana
Reviews.Content: One night was just a taste of how wonderful this hotel is - the building itself and all the furnishings were perfect. The courtyard and pools area is so inviting - it would be hard to leave if you wanted to do something else. In the morning, there was coffee and tea by the pool and in the afternoon, there was water and iced tea. The staff is excellent - we were escorted directly to our room by Henry. He brought us a bucket of ice and 2 complimentary glasses of wine - we thought that was a nice touch, especially since the Cafe was closed during our stay. We would stay here again in a heartbeat! And next time it will have to be longer than just one night.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing.”
Reviews.Author: Karl M
Reviews.Content: This place is a gem. From arrival to departure it was everything we wanted: quaint charm, attention to details, authentic character. They make you feel special. Would highly recommend this place for a romantic getaway.

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: Rob B
Reviews.Content: I have been to Key West many times and this was my first stay at the Marquesa....I was totally impressed. This was one of the cleanest hotels I have ever stayed in. Just like other reviewers of this hotel, after a night of partying on Duval st, which by the way it is conveniently located to everything on Duval!!, it was nice to come back to this tranquil paradise. Pools were great, they don't have a pool bar but you can get your own booze right around the block at a local convenience store, and store them in your fridge or just ask the staff and they will get you a frozen margarita or whatever else you prefer from there restaurant. Staff was great, probably the kindest staff I have ever had the pleasure to deal with. My only regret was not trying there restaurant as I heard has gotten great reviews. I will save that for next time because I will be back and will definitely be staying at the Marquesa!! Thank you for a great trip!!

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful paradise in Key West”
Reviews.Author: MiamiFirefighter
Reviews.Content: Wanted to get a quiet getaway by myself in Key West for a couple of days. This was the place. Everything is pristine here and this is the best B&B in Key West. The restaurant food is excellent. The rooms are wonderful. I have stayed here before and have had the pleasure of staying in several different rooms throughout the property. All the rooms are beautifully decorated and spacious. The property has two pools of which one is heated. The lush landscaping makes your stay quite enjoyable when you return from walking on Duval street. Sitting by the pool in this little paradise really made all the stresses of life just go away.

Reviews.Title: “A glorious tropical oasis”
Reviews.Author: Izatequilafan!
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in many places in key west over the last 30 years so to check into a place we had overlooked was a breathe of fresh air.I'm just going to give a basic overlay because I find long overblown posts tend to lose people's attention. Reception and the welcome is first class,and I mean first class! Rooms have everything,tastefully decorated and very comfy and cozy. Pool area is stunning,it made me sigh daily! Cleaning staff lovely and friendly and do a great job. We WILL definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Most tranquil resort in Key West”
Reviews.Author: kmommy2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed here August 5-7th 2011 for my birthday. We were hesitant to stay some where new, and we are so glad we did!! The Marquesa is perfect! Incredibly clean with all the amenities you need. Very quiet, and concierge is very helpful and friendly. You are offered wine upon arrival, which we never took, and they settle you into your room. There are two pools and they have tea and lemonade out daily. We took alcohol and made our own cocktails to take by the pool. The bed was comfortable, and the bathroom was spacious. It is very very secure at night. After 1 am, you have to ring the door bell to enter, which we had to do each night.. :) They do have a restaurant that smells awesome, but we didn't eat there, as we hopped bars/restaurants most of the time for light appetizers each time. The walk to Duval is short and everything is very close. Even the walk to Southernmost point isn't bad either. We had a pool side room with a shared porch, but very quiet.. room 12... Awesome room. I have no complaints, and had a great time. We are currently booking our December trip now, back to Marquesa!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Kelly2411
Reviews.Content: From our complimentary glass of wine upon our arrival, to our room location, everything was great. We received a room upgrade which made it even more enjoyable. The room was nice and clean and had an outside porch. I wish we could have stayed longer to enjoy the porch and surroundings. The outdoors are beautiful and peaceful. It would be the perfect place to have a family reunion or wedding. You can walk to Duval Street which of course is perfect, no driving and no taxi. The only negative was on the weekday mornings, we could hear the traffic outside our window....not enough to ruin our stay of course. Sean was great!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MacTraveller64
Reviews.Content: I took a guys trip to Key West in Nov 2010 and we stayed at the Marquesa Hotel. I would love to return with my wife. The hotel was quaint and romantic - completely wasted on our group. The location was great. Easy walking distance to the main drag and everywhere else. There was secure off-street parking and easy check-in. Our rooms were great. They were well appointed and the linens were very comfortable.The bathrooms were large and included all the necessary toiletries. Best of all, our upstairs room included access to a large porch overlooking the street. This was perfect for having happy hour. The pool was a nice place to hang out. It was anything but crowded. The only thing missing was a jacuzzi. A small business center was perfectly adequate for our needs. I did not check out the exercise facility. There is a restaurant on property which looked very nice. It also looked a little pricey, but probably has food worth the cost. We had other restaurants on our agenda and so did not try this. The staff was friendly and helpful. We consulted with them regarding fishing, etc. and they had much useful information. If I go back to Key West I would happily return to the Marquesa.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis.”
Reviews.Author: lscCanfield_Ohio
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marquessa Hotel Key West in June 2010 and found it to be an oasis in the middle of the craziness in Key West. The grounds were lovely with rwo pools surrounded by lush plants and floewers. We were greeted by Richard, the manager who showed us to our room - a bungalow next to the pool. Then we sat on our porch while being served a welcome glass of wine. Everyone of the staff knew us by name and went out of their way to accomidate us. Richard even went to the bike rental store for us, brouhgt the bike to us, and returned it at the end of our stay. Overall, the service was outstanding!

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: KWK59
Reviews.Content: Fabulous place to stay! All the amenities of an upscale hotel, along with the comfort and coziness of a beautiful B&B. We stayed here for a week, and from day one to day seven, everything was perfect. We were greeted upon arrival by Henry, who explained everything about the hotel and provided information on Key West. After answering any and all of our questions, he told us to go ahead to our room and get comfortable and he would bring our luggage to us. He also offered us a glass of wine (on the house!), which was a great way to settle in and relax. The staff, grounds, room, and pools were all wonderful. We couldn't have asked for a more relaxing vacation. We stayed in a standard room in the main house, and it was beautiful, with lots of natural light. The hotel and grounds are very clean and well-maintained by a staff that is always there, but not intrusive. They are gracious and helpful when asked, but you barely know they're there otherwise. Excellent! The hotel will also recommend and book activities for you (we went para-sailing), which is a nice amenity. Only thing I would say is that the breakfast offered for $10 per person is a little light for the price; but we found plenty of lovely places that served breakfast within a few short blocks of the hotel. We will definitely stay here again when we return to Key West.....loved it!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean, quiet getaway in Key West”
Reviews.Author: rustito
Reviews.Content: My partner and I had a very nice stay at the Marquesa. We were upgraded to a large suite on the top floor of the main house. It was a comfortable room with a large bathroom and lots of places to sit. Next time we would get a room with its own balcony, because the only way you could relax outside was at poolside, and sometimes we wanted to be outside with a little more privacy/quiet than the pool. The facilities were all immaculately clean. Two pools -- one cooler than the other, depending on your mood -- and plenty of seating and tables. It was generally very quiet Despite their no-kids policy, they did allow a toddler to stay while we were there. It wasn't a major problem for us, but I talked to at least one guest who stayed at the Marquesa specifically to avoid kids on her vacation and I'll bet she was not happy. We'll definitely be coming back to the Marquesa given its cleanliness, the friendliness of its staff, and its convenience to all the attractions.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful Key West experience”
Reviews.Author: campbetc
Reviews.Content: We booked a three-night stay at the Marquesa last week after we had to check out of our original hotel unexpectedly. I read the wonderful reviews on TripAdvisor and was able to get a room in the main house for a very reasonable price. From the moment we stepped inside the heavenly air-conditioning of the lobby, our expectations in all areas were surpassed. Caroline at the front desk was friendly and welcoming, and gave us a free glass of wine after we checked in. Our room on the third floor was sparkling clean, cool, and well-appointed, with window seats under the gables and a view out over Fleming St. The room was kept clean and neat and the turndown service each night was great. Everyone at the front desk was incredibly friendly and helpful throughout our stay. One of the best things about the Marquesa is the beautiful hidden courtyard with two pools. The garden is beautifully landscaped and there are towels, lounge chairs, and free water and iced tea (and, in the morning, coffee) for guests. We spent one long afternoon lounging there and it was wonderfully relaxing! Overall, I canâ€™t think of a single thing I would change about our stay. The Marquesa was a lucky find for us, and weâ€™ll absolutely recommend it to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: AnnieMi
Reviews.Content: This was a very charming and relaxing hotel. The location was excellent. The location is just a very quick walk away to everything but without all the noise at night when you're ready to relax back in your room. We stayed in room 10 within the main house. The room was a little small but it was immaculate and very tastefully decorated with a very comfortable bed. We felt the value for the price was very reasonable. It was a beautiful oasis. We will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: NC32
Reviews.Content: Amazing stay in every way....only breakfast not worth the money but plenty of places locally to get this. Will definately be back.

Reviews.Title: “Calm Oases of beauty in Key West center.”
Reviews.Author: MitziLinka
Reviews.Content: A beautiful and dreamy hotel that has your dreams coming true in interior and exterior design. Slumber land with a fantastic bed. We stayed in room 18 jnr. suite poolside and felt it was the best even if there were bigger rooms. Kids under 14 years a no, however a mistake on booking helps our 3 year slip through the cracks. The attached restaurant also called the Marquesa was an unbelievable tantalizing delicious dance on my tasted buds. Having both hotel and restaurant with such greatness under one room we should all vote for "Wonders of the World" category.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful vacation get-away”
Reviews.Author: PhillyFeet
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 2 nights and wished we had stayed longer. We had a deluxe queen on the 3rd floor of the main building. The room was large, clean and extremely quiet. Only downside, is because it is a historic building, they cannot have an elevator. So while the walk upstairs was fine for us, it may be a difficult climb for some. We enjoyed the pool during the extremely hot afternoons. As their policy is guest must be 14 years of age or older, there were no splashing screaming children in the pool. Just other couples relaxing like us. The location is great, close to everything without being in the middle of the craziness. The staff was wonderful and check-in prompt. Robert gave us great suggestions for lunch and even though we arrived several hours early, the room was quickly available. I would definitely return here again- but i'd stay a lot loner than 2 nights!

Reviews.Title: “Marquesa - Tranquility in Key West”
Reviews.Author: BIODTL
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, pool courtyard is exceptional (except they really could use a small bar area out there for some cocktails) but we made our own and brought them down. Staff is attentive and pay attention to detail. Especially Henry (nice job). Marquesa restaurant is very good and possibly best in Key West. Hotel is one block away from the Duval crawl - just far enough away from the noice but close enough to crawl back to on an eventful evening. We'll be back. Would be nice to have some breakfast included.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in the middle of Key West”
Reviews.Author: KJACK8
Reviews.Content: MY wife and I are seasoned travellers from Northants in England. This beautiful hotel had all the Key West charm. We had room 9 right on the front. We had read in reviews that it could be noisy, but once we had set foot in our room/suite we didnot want to move. We would give it 5 star rating. It was light and airy from 5 sash windows and extremely well furnished. The pool area was tranquil and peaceful a little gem of an oasis one block away from the hustle and bustle of Duval Street. the staff were attentive and gave excellent service. The resteraunt was very good, but the night we went it was very noisey all the lady customers were trying to outshout each other. The rooms may be a little expensive to other hotels but worth every penny. Very highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “We love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: fenwickbob
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at the Marquesa several times before. The Marquesa never disappoints. Service is very good and the place is beautiful. The associated restaurant is also excellent. Two pools, one heated and one not is an added feature.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: JFK56
Reviews.Content: In this age of cookie cutter hotels, it's nice to find a place like the Marquesa. Charming, historical, tucked away from the noise but close enough to easily walk to all the action on Duval! We stayed in one of the junior suites (#6, which I would recommend) and enjoyed it immensely, from coffee and tea at poolside to coming back to our room at night and finding the bed turned down and chocolates waiting with the ice bucket filled. Very friendly staff. Our flight didn't leave until the evening, but when we checked out the manager told us to feel free to continue to enjoy the pool area as well as a separate bathroom and shower to clean up and change prior to our departure. Didn't get the opportunity to dine at the Marquesa Cafe but heard from others it is great. The Marquesa consists of the main building (built around 1884, as I recall), and several additional historical Key West homes that were apparently moved to the site. All nicely updated, and the courtyard pool areas and gardens are beautiful. Will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel in Heart of Key West”
Reviews.Author: nycgal12
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a few days at the Marquesa and greatly enjoyed our stay. The pool areas are lovely and it was particularly nice to be able to relax outside on the suite's private balcony. One note: when reserving a room, be sure to request one away from the street. The noise on Simonton could be very loud at night. We were greeted with complimentary glasses of wine upon our arrival and the service was very attentive throughout our stay. We also enjoyed dinner at the Cafe Marquesa one night (although we had to wait for a table because they had us down for the wrong time). The food was excellent - probably the best meal of the trip. A few things that would have made our stay even better: (1) Breakfast really should be included in the price of the room. For $495/night, they could throw in a cup of coffee and some oatmeal. (2) Although it's possible that a small bar might affect the tranquility of the pool area, it would be nice to have a place to get a rum punch or beer while enjoying the sun by the pool. All in all, though, a wonderful stay at the Marquesa.

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Britsinthetarn
Reviews.Content: Elegant hotel, really friendly service and informative advice about what to do and see in Key West, nicely appointed rooms with great attention to detail, just a gem and a peaceful haven in rather a bustling environment.. We would highly recommend this hotel for couples.

Reviews.Title: “The Marquesa just keeps getting better”
Reviews.Author: CalamitySal
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our annual winter renewal trip to the Marquesa Hotel and Cafe Marquesa, marveling at how Carol and her wonderful staff keep making things better for us. Usually when you fall in love with a hotel or restaurant, you risk the very real chance of disenchantment when returning. Not only has that not happened to us in our 5 years of coming to this wonderful place, we no longer even fear it happening. As with every other visit, we find something new and delightful (in this case, poolside coffee and tea in the morning) to join the very long list of things we already adore, such as poolside ice tea during the day, wine and cheese on Saturday, beautiful decor, tropical gardens, delicious meals, and immaculate housekeeping. The best part of our visit remains the warm wlecomes and endless help from the staff, including Bob, Mary, Richard and Shaun. If heaven isn't like the Marquesa, we will be severely disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Small Hotel in Terrific Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: MysticSusan
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been beautifully remodeled and a true oasis in the middle of a busy city. It is close to Duvall Street without being in the traffic and noise. An easy walk to restaurants, shops, and attractions. If you book one of the "standard rooms" which we did as it was the only room left, be sure to ask the reservation agent about the views from the windows. We were told our room faced the Gardens but were not told that the view out the window was of the roof of the restaurant next to the gardens and of the exhaust fan serving the restaurant. This was a huge disappointment to us. The room itself was fine but small, which we were expecting. My only suggestion to the hotel would be to have at least one staff member at a location that is accessible to the guests. The computers and business functions are in a room off the parlor with a door and glass window. Employees sit with their backs to the door.

Reviews.Title: “Best in Key West ... fourth time back.”
Reviews.Author: javabeach
Reviews.Content: We've been coming to Key West for 6-years. We have stayed at the Marquesa for the last four. This is the best place to stay in Key West. Excellent quality, beautiful rooms, lush landscaping, walking distance to everything (we never rent a car, only bikes). We took our adult daughter with us this year and had a very nice time. Room 20 gets nice morning sunshine on the porch. ... great for a morning cup of coffee in the tropical breeze. You gotta try this place!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Key West!”
Reviews.Author: StovertrottersJunkie
Reviews.Content: This is the BEST Hotel in Key West hands down. Just a block off Duval Street you step into this cozy, charming, quiet retreat that is a true experience of totally relaxation! The staff was wonderful, kind, attentive and very professional. Our past trips to Key West we have stayed at the La Concha and the Pier House, both of those hotels don't even compare to the Marquesa. This will be the only hotel we stay at when we travel to Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Piece of Heaven”
Reviews.Author: Travelingaddicted
Reviews.Content: A wonderful place to spend a birthday. This is our second time visiting the area. Service was excellent, staff was helpful and location perfect. We tried biking this year and found it a lovely way to see the island. We suggest you choose a room overlooking the pools and gardens so it is quiet and picturesque. We would highly recommend the restaurant attached to this hotel. The location is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: NYCtraveler076
Reviews.Content: The marquesa was a very nice inn. The room was nice, the property was beautiful and the location was fantastic. Would recommend to anyone planning in going to key west.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect breakfast!!!”
Reviews.Author: allen_10030
Reviews.Content: While the hotel is fine and the staff really nice, don't be surprised at the $10. pp extra charge for a sleazy breakfast. And, it is a fair walk to a breakfast spot from there. They are members of the SELECT REGISTRY OF DISTINQUISHED INNS OF NORTH AMERICA. The comments there on cuisine are misleading at best. Good location, but bring food!

Reviews.Title: “Return to paradise!!”
Reviews.Author: mw666
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our second stay at the Marquesa Everything was fine as usual,it really is an oasis of calm in Key West It's 2 blocks from Duval Street but could be 2 miles as it's so quiet. The staff keep it in perfect condition and for Shaun nothing is to much trouble. We will return as soon as possible keep doing what your doing please

Reviews.Title: “Why stay anywhere else?”
Reviews.Author: johnnlisa
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel based on TA reviews. Upon arrival we were greeted by Richard and made to feel as if we were the only guests. Richard sat down with us to review the both the history of the property as well as the current ammenities. He then reviewed the highlights of Key West. Richard offered that the hotel would make any necessary arrangements for extracurricular activites, including transportation rentals, meals and/or leisure activities. Following our introduction he met us at the garage entry and directed where to park the car. After leading us to our room, he filled the ice bucket and returned with two complimentary glasses of wine. The landscaping is amazing. Everything from the swimming pools, one heated and one not, both by design, to the manicured grounds. The courtyard, onto which the rooms and main entry opens, are truly an oasis. The main house and surrounding buildings were stunning. No detail was overlooked for an immaculate fit and finish. Our first room, a standard room, was charming, intimate and relaxing. We loved Key West so much, that we decided to stay another night. Due to a lack of avilability our standard rooms, we were upgraded to a JUNIOR SUITE for the same price we paid for the standard room. This room was poolside and amazing. Attention to detail and superior customer service made for a memorable trip and we already know where we are staying next time.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise in Key West - Go on..... treat yourselves !”
Reviews.Author: Gwalltcoch
Reviews.Content: Booked three nights stay at the Marquesa based purely on Tripadvisor reviews - Upon arrival we could see that this was the correct decision.This hotel is immaculate in every respect and a little piece of paradise in the middle of Key West. Paid an on-line "offer " price of $250 per night for a suite and justified this amount due to it being our last three nights stay of a two week tour of Florida. If you fancy a treat stay here. There is a local supermarket within 100 yds if you need anything - they also have an excellent deli that makes tasty fresh sandwiches while you wait. Considered the Marquesa to be one of the best small hotels we've ever stayed in........That's a compliment.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: lmgtiny
Reviews.Content: Made a spur of the moment reservation at Marquese by phone and checked in the following day. On arrival we were greeted by Mary, who has a way about her, one of the most gracious people I have ever met. She showed us to our room, and returned a few minutes later with wine for us. Everything about this hotel is perfect. Extremely comfortable, very pretty, very relaxing, amazing staff. After having dinner at Marquesa's restaurant - also very good, the waiter offered to deliver dessert to our room since we were tired and stuffed, and he walked with us, carrying dessert back to our room. Marquesa is heaven.

Reviews.Title: “It was absolutely perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: KeyWestLvr
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Key West. My boyfriend visited two years ago. He stayed at a different location on Duvall Street which he said it was ok, nothing that nice, but it was clean. The place he stayed was alot more expensive too. When we arrived he said not to get too upset if it wasn't that nice. Boy were we both surprised! It looks pretty simple from the street. But once you go inside it is absolutely beautiful. The location couldn't be more perfect for all the sightseeing and nightlife. The staff is so friendly too. My only regret was that we couldn't stay longer. I'm so hoping we can return to Key West and I would not stay anywhere else but The Marquesa!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect From Initial Contact!”
Reviews.Author: TravelAgentFL
Reviews.Content: This trip to Key West was made specifically to stay at the Marquesa. From my initial comunnication with the hotel's owner and the hotel's manager, Ms. Wightman and Robert, I was treated with tremendous professionalism and great care. I could not have asked for greater care, attention to detail and communication. The level of professionalism and customer care went beyond my expectations. Check-in was a delight. The gentlman, Richard, who extended welcome on behalf of the Marquesa was professional and gracious. The junior suite (#21) was immaculate and, of course, tasteful in decor. It is utterly amazing that this property maintains immaculate conditions everywhere. The cleaning staff is to be congratulated for their care and attention to detail. Each evening, turn-down service was carefully executed. Ice was replenished, blinds closed, lights turned on, towels replenished and chocolate left on the night table. Again, perfection! The grounds are maintained with supreme care. Those responsible for the grounds are to be congratulated for their excellent work. From orchids to palms, everything was beautiful and reflected the "paradise" one equates with the Marquesa. The guests staying at this property were delightful. It was enjoyable to speak with them and learn that they, too, were enjoying the peaceful beauty and respecting the solace. The Marquesa distinguishes itself in myriad ways, not the least of which is the quality of guests it attracts. Interestingly, we (guests) spoke of the level of comfort and beauty that one pays for when choosing the Marquesa. The Marquesa did not disappoint. One morning, I had breakfast served in the room. It was timely, hot, and delicious. We enjoyed dinner at the Marquesa Cafe. The food was perfect, the staff was gracious and the environment - like the rest of the property - immaculately cared for. Iced tea, fresh lemon, water, ice, plastic cups, straws and large plush towels were provided poolside each day. Again, care was taken to maintain the beverages, ice and towels throughout the day. Mary, a lovely lady who works at the property, is gracious and a ever helpful. She typifies the graciousness that is the Marquesa. Mary cares for guests during the day with a gentle welcoming spirit that is appreciated by guests, and obviously valued by the Marquesa. The Marquesa is a quality "experience". It is much more than simply a hotel. While the cost is significant to stay at the Marquesa, when measured against the level of care, comfort, cleanliness and peace that one can expect at this property, the benefits outweigh the cost by substantial measure. I travel often. I stay at myriad properties and usually take the time to comment when they are awful or excellent, rarely when they are adequate. The Marquesa is beyond excellent. I enjoyed 5 wonderful days at this lovely property and would encourage any TripAdvisor reader to safely reserve at this property knowing that one can reasonably expect a bit of perfection in paradise! Kudos and thank you to Ms. Wightman, Robert, Richard, Mary and all at the Marquesa!

Reviews.Title: “Charming!”
Reviews.Author: travelpuss
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay at the Marquesa and we were equally pleased with it. The location is great, as it it is just out of the busy area but in easy walking distance of the shops and bars of Duval St. Our room a was very clean and well appointed and the meal that we had in the Cafe Marquesa was excellent and accompanied by friendly and attentive service. The hotel is small and has a very charming, relaxed atmosphere- we hope to return again next year :)

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, Clean, Cozy, and Quiet”
Reviews.Author: nhjimmyd
Reviews.Content: The Marquesa offered a quaint and cozy stay that felt more like an inn than a hotel. We chose the Marquesa based on its location, free parking, and amazing reviews, and we werenâ€™t disappointed. Perfectly located two blocks from the heart of Duval Street, it was amazing how quiet and secluded this place was once we stepped inside. We were a bit surprised that the front desk was just thatâ€”a small deskâ€”and check-in was really slow, but the management was really personable, escorting us to our room and telling us all about the hotel features and Key West. As we expected, the room was small, but it was exceptionally clean and we were ecstatic to get a spacious veranda with our room overlooking the street. On the down side the mattress was a bit uncomfortable and squeaky, seemingly amplified by the extreme quiet inside the hotel. In fact, the hotel seemed eerily quiet, and we found ourselves tip-toeing around and trying to be quiet locking and unlocking the old doors to our room. When we came in off Duval Street late one night we felt like teenagers sneaking past our parentsâ€™ room as we passed the front desk. The courtyard area was amazing and we enjoyed cooling by in the pool after a day in the sun of Key West. Check out the pictures in the lobby area showing the before and after photos to truly appreciate what a phenomenal renovation this building has gone through.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, relaxing hotel in great location - excellent customer service!”
Reviews.Author: unclawyer
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the Marquesa in June as a celebration of our 10 year wedding anniversary. From the moment I called and made reservations, the staff was fantastic. After making the reservation, I later saw a special on the website for a free room upgrade and contacted the hotel. They graciously offered the upgrade and made excellent suggestions for dinners, sunset sails, etc. - better than any large hotel concierge I've ever encountered. We ate at Cafe Marquesa our last night there and were amazed by the attention and service at the restaurant. Our table had tasteful, festive ribbons to celebrate our anniversary and the food was amazing. I highly suggest a relaxing morning swim and breakfast before heading out for the day. The orchids and other plants surrounding the beautifully landscaped courtyard made our mornings in the back pool (heated pool) a peaceful oasis. As far as I could tell, it wasn't heated, or at least not noticeably so, because it was already so hot outside. Only caveat would be: if you have any mobility challenges, be sure to ask about your room location. Ours was on the 3rd floor so required climbing and descending narrow stairs. Next time I will spring for a poolside villa - they looked heavenly!

Reviews.Title: “It's like a relaxing meditation, an oasis in the middle of Key West”
Reviews.Author: Flightygirl
Reviews.Content: What can I say....it was our 6th or 7th visit to Key West at the Marquesa. Perfect location ...far enough away from Duval but close enough to walk. We do not go to the Marquesa for night life but rather to recharge our batteries. It is quiet, the only sounds are the water falls located around the pools. Fresh Ice tea and cold water served all day at the pool....topped off with some watermelon! Sara Beth's restaurant located across the street, Antonia's just a block down Duval, just a few blocks to Pepe's, close enough to walk to Sunset pier and great suggestions from the front desk on where to eat if you want to try something new. Firm beds, great staff, and clean! Nightly turn down......fresh ice delivered to the room! Cookies on arrival, wine if you want a glass, orchids everywhere......what more can I say. ....It is the BEST!

Reviews.Title: “Well appointed rooms.”
Reviews.Author: billyhoover38
Reviews.Content: To stay at the Marquesa is to be surrounded by the finer things. Our room was rich and comfortable. The textures in the fabrics, the nice tropical colors, all around a treat. The pool is small but quiet. This was an uncommon experience.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis in Key West”
Reviews.Author: dburkett
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Marquesa Hotel for five nights in June 2010 based on the recommendation of friends (who were also traveling with us). I can't say enough good things about this boutique hotel. The staff were very attentive - everything is spotless (even the pool-side restroom). I took advantage of the promotion they offered that provided an upgraded room. Therefore, I booked a stanrdard room but received a pool-side deluxe room. The size of the room was adequate. As I mentioned before, everything was spotless. Upon arriving, we were treated to a glass of wine by the pool. Hotel staff was happy to point out great places to dine and sites to see. One afternoon, we were treated to fresh watermellon by the pool in addition to the water and iced tea that was offered daily. The staff was very attentive without being intrusive. There are two pools w/ adequate chairs and umbrellas. The location of the hotel is ideal if you want to be a short walk to Duval Street but far enough away from the noise and crowds. I highly recommend this hotel to those who appreicate boutique hotels and have high expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Best Service and Best Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: PJZ2006
Reviews.Content: The Marquesa is hands down the nicest, most romantic, most relaxing hotel we have stayed at together. The service was great and very personalized. We walked or biked everywhere from our hotel. And the cafe was so good we ate there multiple times for a delicious dinner. And the pool was perhaps the most beautiful spot on the island. We had a king suite, and the bathroom had a nice big tub, and the room was very spacious. The pool side rooms looks great as well. I highly recommend this hotel for any couple staying in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to be!”
Reviews.Author: Allesneu
Reviews.Content: The Marquesa is a lovely place close to everything you need: itâ€™s located in a quiet street parallel to the mainstreet Duval. The hotel is a gorgeous, very well kept typical Key West Hotel with two pools (one heated, one unheated). You will find yourself taken care of in every way. A glas of wine to welcome you and great tips where to eat, rent a bike, go for a snorkelling trip, etc. pp. We stayed in room 22 with a great porch, it felt like being at home when we sat on the porch with our breakfast (continental breakfast can be preordered until 2pm and will be brought to your room) If you go to Key West make sure that you stay at Marquesa - its worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: “Skip the Chains and Enjoy the Brightest Gem in the Keys”
Reviews.Author: bgparker
Reviews.Content: The Marquesa is a brilliantly renovated group of late-Victorian homes a block or so from Duval Street. The main building (which houses a few of the rooms, the office, and the delicious Cafe Marquesa) opens to an intimate and beautifully landscaped pool area around which the remainder of the guest rooms and suites cluster. We stayed in a Junior Suite (comfy kingsize bed, separate parlor with hideabed couch, spacious bath) and it was like a high-end boutique room.
